alert.note: Alert for Carlton; St. Louis (Minnesota) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Duluth (Northeast Minnesota and Northern Wisconsin)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued August 18 at 10:11AM CDT by NWS Duluth
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 1230 PM CDT THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...A portion of northeast Minnesota, including the following counties, Carlton and St. Louis. * WHEN...Until 1230 PM CDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Ponding of water in urban or other areas is occurring or is imminent. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1009 AM CDT, Gauge reports indicated heavy rain fell Wednesday evening. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Between 2 and 4 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 2 inches are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Moose Lake, Barnum, Mahtowa, Cromwell, Kettle River, Fond Du Lac Band Sawyer Area, Fond Du Lac Band Cloquet Area, Big Lake, Automba, Wright, Prairie Lake, Kettle Lake, Moose Lake State Park and Sawyer. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely.
